Author: joeguilmette
Content:
I've been looking for this video ever since his 'last lecture'. Watching that lecture was a powerful experience. I'd heard many people talk about how great this lecture is, and even found the ppt files.

Thanks!

Content: the last paragraph of this article is advice i've been given many times. steve jobs history of success is so similar to so many other successful people.

Content: This is more or less a response to http://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=70757 -- I started writing it there, but ended up deciding that it made more sense as a separate blog piece.

Author: earthboundkid
Content:
NeXT was a dismal failure.

Depends on what you consider success. No NeXT, no WorldWideWeb by Tim Berners-Lee. I consider changing the world forever to be a success condition.

due to a bit of Gassee's inability to market it properly, BeOS lost out despite how many internally wanted it instead.

Be != NeXT

Author: earthboundkid
Content:
What specifically was wrong with it? I saw maybe two or three awkward sentences, but only because I was looking for them. He used the word "keiretsu" without explanation, which I find kind of pretentious, but then again, I did know what it meant, so it worked.

Or was it changed between when you saw it and when I saw it?

Author: sohail
Content: "The real question of today's Gilded Age, highlighted by the comparison to its predecessor, is not why the rich became rich, or whether they behave well with their billions. It's why the rest of us seem to feel we can do so little about it."
